dct_title_s: Theatrum Terræ Sanctæ et biblicarum historiarum
dct_alternative_sm: Theatrvm Terræ Sanctæ et biblicarvm historiarvm
dct_description_sm: Gold-leafed decorative borders and seals on front and back covers; gold-leafed and floral patterned fore-edge.
First 2 and last 2 pages blank (included in page description.)
Engraved title page, head and tail-pieces throughout.
"Cum gratia et privilegio" on titile page.
Descriptive text accompanies maps (including index numbers); descriptive text on maps.
Decorative cartouches, banners, compass roses, bar scales.
Maps show topography, vegetation, waterways, routes.
Illustrations of settlements, figures, fauna, ships, sea monsters.
Map 12 is a bird's eye view, including city plan of Jerusalem (title translation: Jerusalem, and its surroundings, as it was at the time of Christ).
dct_publisher_sm: in Officina Birkmannica, sumptibus Arnoldi Mylii,
dct_rights_sm: Images from the The Renaissance Exploration Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
